Header: Simone Biles wins fourth all-around World Gymnastics Championships title
Content: Simone Biles made history by becoming the first woman to win four all-around titles at the World Championships. Biles had not competed internationally since the 2016 Olympics, while she revealed in January she had been sexually abused by a former Team USA sports doctor. In addition, the 21-year-old American was admitted to hospital with a kidney stone on the eve of the Worlds. Biles had previously shared the record of three all-around world golds with Svetlana Khorkina of Russia.
